内置的皮卡丘。
然后连接精灵球的话会送一个梦幻。
玩起来还不错，比ps4，便携性高。
已经买了塞尔达，等游戏了，再试一下。
生产烂货，出售烂货，结果烂货服务，买了六块手表送孩子的，其中的一快数字显示不完全，六块的时间都不一致，相差十几个小时不等。
我联系厂家问手表在入库有核对时间吗?他们回复说“有”，既然有，那为啥时间相差那么多，那肯定是手表没有精确度，简单地说就是水货产品，不是我说的难听，看嘛，很明显的质量问题（数字显示不完全）都拿出来卖，是不是垃圾货。
我联系卖家，卖家说了一大堆的理由，还埋怨当初不应该买他们的东西，这样的产品，这样的卖家，这样的售后服务，以后谁还敢在亚马逊上买东西。
总之我建议不要跟此卖家买东西，买了也是垃圾东西。
亚马逊发货问题
收到货后检查发现：
1、表包装严重破旧。
2、表说明书有严重使用褶皱。
3、表不走，台灯充电也无发使用，无法调整时间。
4、分别联系亚马逊客服，只能自费邮寄至美国，后补邮费。
5、2分的原因是客服服务还不错。
只能说还凑合
时间不是非常准，每天约快一秒，用了才几个月已经快两分多了。
以前用过一块西铁城的，感觉一两年也不会差几秒。
万年历功能倒是蛮不错，计时功能有点鸡肋，基本用不到，偶尔会误触进入计时模式。
太阳能运动手表
优点：太阳能充电不用担心须更换电池、具备世界时间、多种闹铃及整点提醒。
不足：镜面容易划伤、进灰尘。
性价比：国内一般价格在220-300之间，海外购到手180多（用时1周左右）。
很满意的手表
肯定是正品，去专柜验过货，表的外观很漂亮，做工精细，用料足，加上又是进口机械机芯，所以是有一定的分量的，是那些三四百所谓的机械表不能比的，这个是货真价实的。
表的走时是很准的，误差完全在可接受范围内，表的包装里有珠宝鉴定证书，表盘的12字那里是真钻石，这个自己戴很合适，作为礼品送出去也很有面子。
宾利表确实不错。
有史以来体验最差的一次购物
9月23日晚上老婆手机摔了，心血来潮立马来亚马逊订购了一台8p，有货但是不是自营的且没有加价（心里暗喜），由于不是自营的发货比较慢，系统显示预计最晚收货要到9月27日。
老婆没手机用难受死了，第二天一早6点多叫我在想想办法，后来上京东一看256G有货可以当天送到，只得立马再订购一台。
新的买好了，就想着马上把亚马逊的订单给取消。
由于订单是半夜下的，没可能凌晨来收快递，7点多打给客服要求取消订单，客服答复已经取消请等待短信通知。
好吧，我就耐心的等着，到了中午上手机一看，订单还在状态还处于未发货，就立马联系客服要求赶快取消订单，客服答复已经操作OK。
到了下午3点上手机一看订单还在，没办法只能再次联系客服明确告知已经第三次来电了，请取消订单并通知卖家务必不要发货！
客服在我要求下当场联系了卖家，并告知我卖家不熟悉系统，要等熟悉系统后再操作取消订单。
但是明确告诉我卖家已经知道了，绝对不会发货的请放心。
等到周一我再看订单显示，竟然已经发货了，我也是无语了。
由于无法直接联系卖家，只能再次致电客服。
后面的处理简直无语，基本都是我说一步，客服才接着操作一下。
订单到目前为止还是处于派件拒收状态，正准备再次派送！
亚马逊难道不会主动跟进下吗？
卖家公司反正也收了钱不跟进也无所谓了。
总结下以后大件绝对不会预付钱了，这个样子太麻烦了。
看起来很美好
很久以前就看中这个摄像头了，但是因为除了价格外，还有一些别的原因，所以没有购买，这次因为凑包邮，价格也还可以所以就买了。
买来之后其他的都没什么问题，就是在软件连接的时候，怎么都连不上，我家是TP的路由器，上网查了之后发现好多人都有这个问题，弄了两个多小时，各种改路由器的设置，最后我用360WIFI作为媒介给弄好的，期间给小米客服打电话，他们对这个问题也没有什么解决方法，直接就让我联系亚马逊进行售后。
另外一点值得注意的就是我在网上看到用户的评论说，这个摄像头支持的存储卡最小是8G，存储容量更小的就不能识别，希望大家注意这点。
用起来感觉还可以吧，画面还可以接受，但声音音质很差，机器有一定程度的发热，一直开启的话，感觉这种程度的发热有点让人难以接受。
综上所述，本产品还有诸多不足，希望大家买的时候要慎重。
之所以给3星，是因为这个是和人生的初恋买的，交往了快3年，就这样于去年离我而去了，一直到现在。
之所以给3星，是因为这个是和人生的初恋买的，现在不知道用到什么程度了，或许扔掉了吧！
交往了快3年，就这样于去年离我而去了，到现在一想起她，就心痛的想要离开这个世界，人生中第一个女人，带给我一辈子的阴影和心痛，迄今还没能走出来。
买这个手机的时候，想想两个当时感觉，还是能一起同甘共苦，但现在却是不堪回首，人生或许就是这样吧，有些人一辈子都不想遇到，有些事儿一辈子都不想知道，可是有什么办法呢？
多少次一看到三星这个手机，脑海就想起她，那种痛苦就随之而来灌满全身，我从没舍得用过超过2千元的手机，可是买给她的时候，却毫不犹豫，对一个人再好，可是有天当她变心了，所有的山盟海誓也就烟消云散了。
国产品牌中的精品
华为是国货中的精品。
低调的老总和企业，靠的是技术和质量取胜来赢得客户，这跟当下靠广告运作来提高知名度的营商风气截然不同！
没有实力的企业根本不可能做到这样，也不敢这么做！
正是源于此，我才选择了华为。
买来用了半年多了，感觉一直很好，非常不错。
之所以没有给满分，是因为有一次在用它的离线导航时，出现了不定位现象，我最终没有找出原因，其他时候都很好。
而且它的在线输入好了目的地，搜索之后自动设计出路线，离开wifi出发以后，它自动离线导航的功能很实用，不用跑流量，它直接跟卫星对话来实现定位及导航，非常好！
索尼大法好
索尼的这种低端机，设计感依旧十足，而且价格便宜，屏幕够大，续航力一级棒，给老人使用很合适。
虽然时间已经过去很久了，但这机器依旧没什么毛病。
不过因为我的Z2下放了，所以这台手机也完成了使命。
out: This document is prepared in accordance with the "GB/T 1.1-2022 Standardization Work Guideline Part: Regulations for the Structure and Drafting Rules of Standardization Files."
This file replaces GB 18030-2005 Information Technology "Chinese Character Encoding Set" with the following major differences, apart from structural adjustments and editorial changes:
We have expanded the scope of application for this file (as stated in Chapter 1).

In the GB/T 13000 coding area, we changed the positions of 10 vertical punctuation marks and 8 Han character components. Excluding 6 repeated Han character components and 9 repeated Han characters (as listed in Appendix D of the 2005 version of Appendix A), we made the changes.
In the four-byte encoding zone, 18 GB/T code positions were changed (refer to Appendix D of the 2005 version).
The appendix "Supplementary Chinese Characters and Radicals/Parts" was removed. (Refer to Appendix 0 in the 2005 edition.)
The level of implementation has been increased (as stated in the 9th draft).
Added a data appendix "Common Character Standard Chinese Characters Table; Position of Code for Proposed Characters" in Appendix P.
Please note that certain contents of this file may involve patents. The publisher of this file does not assume responsibility for identifying patents.
This document was issued by the Industrial and Information Technology Department of the People's Republic of China.
The following outlines the release history of this file and its previous versions:
First published as GB 18030-1 in the year 2000, revised for the first time in 2005; this is the second revision.
GB 18030:2022 (Year of publication)
Information Expansion "Chinese Encoding Character Set"
This file specifies the sixteen-hexadecimal representation of Chinese graphic characters used in information technology and their corresponding binary codes.
This file is applicable to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, presentation, input, and output of Chinese and other text, graphic, and character information.
Two regulatory reference files.
The contents of the following files are essential terms of this agreement as referred to in the text.

Among them, the referenced files with marked dates apply only to the corresponding versions mentioned; the referenced files without marked dates, the latest version (including all change orders) applies.
GB/T 2312-1980 "Information interchange Chinese character set - Basic Set"
GB/I 11383-1989 Information processing - Information exchange using eight-bit code structure and encoding rules.
GB 13000 Universal Character Set (UCS) for Information Technology - 8-bit encoding character set.
Three terms and definitions.
The following terms and definitions apply to this file.
3.1 character
An element in a collection of supplies for organization, control, or representation of data.
3.2 coded character: A character encoded in a specific coding system.
Character (3.1) and its encoding.
3.3 User-defined private area
Users of products that comply with this file may determine the designated areas for themselves.
3.4 character repertoire (or vocabulary)
A set of specified characters represented by the encoding character (3.2).
Or, if you prefer a more common English term:
Remain within the specified areas as outlined in this document for future reference.
GB 18030:2022 (Year of publication)
Four characters.
4.1. Summary.
The characters in this file are encoded as single bytes, double bytes, or quad bytes.
The single-byte part includes all the 128 characters from GB/T 11383-1989 in the range of 0x00 to 0x7F.
4.3 byte part.
The two-byte section includes all CJK Unified Han characters and some graphic characters from GB/T 13000 in GB/T 2312-1980.
The characters with two bytes should be processed according to the rules in Appendix A.
Among them, the symbols, code locations, and functions of descriptive annotations should conform to Appendix B specifications.
Note: GB/T 13000 is the uniform coding standard for Chinese characters used in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, and other regions.
Characters with unique abstract forms have their own code positions. Characters with abstract forms that are different in origin but the same in shape, share common code positions.
The Han characters encoded are referred to as CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK represents China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 byte part.

This part records 66 additional CJK Unified Han characters (excluding the 8 characters from 9FB4 to 9FBB) and some ethnic minority characters from GB/T 13000, besides the above-mentioned double-byte characters. It includes CJK Unified Han characters extensions A, BCJK Unified Han characters extensions C, DCJK Unified Han characters extensions, and some ethnic minority characters in the CJK Unified Han character set, as well as the characters already encoded in GB/T 13000.
The four-byte characters follow the rules in Appendix C.
4. Comprehensive structure of five
In the main text, numbers preceded by "0x" represent hexadecimal, while those without "0x" represent decimal.
In the appendix, all encoded representations are in hexadecimal, while other number representations are in decimal.
The single-byte part uses the encoding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, with code points from 0x00 to 0x7F.

The second part of the double-character contribution uses two eight-bit binary strings to represent a character. The first byte's high-order bit ranges from 0x81 to 0xFE, while the low-order bytes have codes 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte portion uses GB/T 11383-1989's unadopted 0x30 and 0x39 as suffixes for extending double-byte encoding, with a coding range of 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The first character of a four-byte Chinese character's GBK encoding ranges from 0x81 to 0xFE; the second character ranges from 0x30 to 0x39; the third character ranges from 0x81 to 0xFE; and the fourth character ranges from 0x30 to 0x39. Therefore, the encoding for "厄尔豆拉果" is 0x81308130 ～ 0x81308139, for "厄尔豆拉六" is 0x81308130 ～ 0x81308136, for "厄尔豆拉九" is 0x81308130 ～ 0x81308139, and for "厄尔豆拉0 FE" is 0xFE39FE30 ～ 0xFE39FE39. For "厄尔豆拉一三", the encoding is 0x81318130 ～ 0x81318133.
The overall structure and bit range allocation are shown in Figure 1 and Table 1.
Six-letter arrangement.
The order of arrangement of characters in a single-character component.
Characters in the single-character record section are arranged in order according to the GB/I 11383-1989 standard for the corresponding characters.
The ordering of some characters in the double-six character set.
The lower part of the characters in the pair should follow the order specified in Appendix A.
The order of arrangement for the characters in the "six-three" four-character idiom.

From 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39, a total of 50,400 bits, represent all GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane characters excluding the double-byte part, arranged in order according to the corresponding characters in the GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, a total of 1058400 bits are used for the corresponding 16 auxiliary planes of GB/T 13000. The character arrangement order is in accordance with the bit order of the 16 auxiliary planes of GB/I 13000.
The four-byte part of the characters should be arranged in the order specified in Appendix C.
Seven-digit position allocation.
Character encoding allocation for single-character cities.
The bit positions for single-byte characters are allocated according to GB/T 11383-1989 standard.
Single bytecode allocation as shown in Figure 2.
Bit allocation for bi-grams.
The byte positions for two-byte characters are divided into the ranges 0x8140 to 0xFE7E and 0x8180 to 0xFEFE, with a total of 23,940 positions.
The byte allocation for two-byte codes is shown in Figure 3 and Table 2.
In total: 23,940 data bits.
Two-byte zone: 846 byte position.
SS WA and RS Double Ning Node 3, 6080 code position.
The first byte is 0xA8-0xA9, the following two bytes represent the number 5 in the 192 code point area.
The most accurate and clear translation would be: Double-character vegetable coding space structure diagram.
Note: This translation assumes that "表 2" means "Table 2" and "双字" means "double characters." If the context is different, the translation may need to be adjusted accordingly.

This term is often used in the context of biometric technology, specifically referring to the area or range within which a human body part, such as a finger or face, can be accurately scanned or recognized by a machine.
Four-character code position allocation.
This part consists of Han Chinese characters and some ethnic minority scripts.
Four-byte human code positions are assigned in Table 3.
Table 3 does not specify the allocation of 4-byte person codes. (Refer to Section 6.3 for details.)
Note: "Four-Character Words" refers to a type of Chinese idiom or phrase consisting of four Chinese characters.
Code position range.
Continuation of Byte Arrangement for Four-Byte Part (Table 3)
Code position, number of digits for each code.
From 0xFD308130 to 0xFE39FE39, there are a total of 25,200 bits for user-defined areas.
Other unused four-byte codes are reserved areas for future file extension use.
Eight parts explanation of characters and codes.
With respect to GB 18030-2005, certain glyphs and/or their corresponding GB/TI 13000 codes in this file have been adjusted (refer to Appendix D).
9.1 General Rule.
This document specifies three implementation levels.
System software products that meet the corresponding implementation levels should provide all character input and output functions within the specified implementation level range.
9.2 Level 1 Implementation
Any product subject to this document must meet level 1 requirements.
Note: Based on the requirements of software application, Level 1 can also select any one or multiple non-Han Chinese scripts listed in Table 3.
9.3 Implementation Level 2.
Level 2 includes Level 1.
In addition, level 2 realizes the encoding of Han characters that are not included in the simplified character set in the "Common Standard Chinese Character Table" within level 1.
The codes and forms of the characters in the "Common Chinese Character Set Table" in this file are listed in the appendix.
System software and supporting software should meet level 2 requirements.

Note: System software and application software include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, and middleware (for software product classification information, see GB/T 36475).
9.4 Level 3 Implementation.
Level 3 includes Level 2.
In addition, implement all Han characters and tables 3's Kangxi headwords as specified in the main text of level 3.
The products used for government and public services should meet the Level 3 assurance requirements.

Note: The administrative service industry and the shared service industry include but are not limited to the railway transport industry, road transport industry, water transport industry, air transport industry, multi-modal transport and logistics, postal industry, monetary financial services, insurance industry, real estate, management, healthcare, national institutions, and social security sectors (for industry classification information, see GB/T 4754).
Appendix A (Regulatory)

Appendix (Data) of "Common Specification Chinese Character Table" - Chinese character code positions.

This file contains all 8,105 standard Chinese characters approved by the State Council of the People's Republic of China and published in 2013, along with their coding positions and forms, as listed in Table 1.

The arrangement order of characters in the table is consistent with that of the 4-standard Chinese character table, with character number 1 being a first-level character, character number 3501 being a second-level character, and character number 6501 being a third-level character.

The contents of this manual page are extracted from the complete documentation of the GNU C Compiler, pertaining only to the meanings of the options.
Except that someone voluntarily maintains, Euro files and Info files are authoritative documents.
If there is a discrepancy between the manual and the software, please check the Info.

If we discover that the content on this manual page is significantly confusing and complaining due to outdatedness, we will stop publishing it. There is no other option, as there is not enough time for us to update the Info file and the man page simultaneously in maintaining Gnu cc. The GNU project considers man pages to be outdated artifacts, and time should be devoted elsewhere.

If you require a complete and up-to-date document, please refer to the Info file `gee' or the Using and Porting GNU CC (for version 2.0) (ft&/H AIZE#H GNU CC 2.0) manual. Both are derived from the Texinfo file gee.texinfo.
Description: C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both need to use one or more steps from the following four: preprocessing, compilation, assembly, and linking, to process input files.
The suffix in the name of a source file identifies the language of the source file, but for a compiler, the suffix controls the default settings.
GCC considers the processed files (.i) to be C files, and sets up C-style linking.
g++ considers the preprocessed files (.i) as C++ files and sets up C++-style linking.
The suffix of the source file indicates the file language type and subsequent operations.
C source code; preprocess, compile, assemble.
C and C++ source code; preprocessing, compiling, assembling.
.cpp is a C++ source file; compile, preprocess, assemble.
C++ source code; compile, preprocess, assemble.
Objective-C source code; preprocess, compile, assemble.
Preprocessed C file; compile, assemble.
.ii: processed C++ files; compile, assemble.
.s Assembly language source file; Assembly.
Assembly language source program; compile, assemble.
.h header files; they are not typically passed to the linker (Compiler) along with other files named at the command line. They usually include:
Object file.
Archive file.
Unless the -cec, -s, or -E options are used (or a compile error prevents it), the linking process is always the final step.

In the linking stage, all files corresponding to the source program's .e files, -1 library files, and unrecognized files (including specified .o H header files and .a library files) are passed to the linker options (OPTIONS) in the order specified in the command line.
The options must be distinctly given out: they are completely different from '-d' and '-r'.
Most options with the prefix `-E` and suffix `:and` in the `gcc` compiler have two opposite formats: `-fname` and `-fno-name` (or `-Wname` and `-Wno-name`).
This section lists formats that are not the default options.
Here are summaries of all the options, grouped by type, with explanations provided in the following sections.
Code Generation Option
Overall Option (or Overall Choice)
Clearly specify the language of the file to be inputted next (rather than defaulting from the file name).
This option applies to all following input files until the next `-x' option with its language specification is encountered.
Disregard any explicit indication of language, therefore based on the file extension, process the following file with the RE AS E `-x' option.

If you only want to operate on certain parts of the four stages (preprocessing, compilation, assembly, linking) in Geo, you can use the `-x` option (or place it after the file name with `.ah`) to tell Geo where to start, and use the `-c`, `-s`, or `-E` options to tell it where to end. Note that some option combinations (for example, `-x cpp-output -E`) will compile or assemble source files with GCC, while ETERA and ATI default to the `.o` and `.s` file names for the object and assembly files, respectively. GCC ignores any unrecognized input file names following the `-ec` option. The `-Sf` option has no effect in this context.
The object file after being processed.
Compile and then stop, no assembling of separate modules.

In different stages of the compilation process, use pipes instead of temporary files for work, as opposed to some system assemblers that cannot read data from pipes. GNU assembler does not have this issue, and it supports C dialects that conform to the ANSI standard.

This will disable certain incompatible ANSI C keywords and features, as well as rarely used ANSI trigraphs such as those indicating UNIX and VAX, in GNU CC. (Note: In a hosted environment, all standard libraries are available, and the main function returns an int value. Correspondingly, there is no standard library in a freestanding environment, and the program entry need not be main. The most obvious example is an operating system kernel. For more details, refer to the latest documentation on the GCC website.)
For a function declaration without parameters in C++ style, that is, without specifying the number or types of parameters, for example, `int foo ();'.
In normal circumstances, an empty parameter function "foo" in C++ means that the function takes no arguments.
The node list is deleted here to support certain aspects of traditional C compilers.
Refer to the NU c manual for details. We have removed the specifics to prevent confusion when the content becomes outdated.
Besides one thing: for a C++ program (not C), the `-traditional` option brings an additional effect, allowing assignment to `this`.
He and the `-Ethis-is-variable' option are equivalent.
traditional-cpp attempts to support certain aspects of the traditional C++ preprocessor.
Specifically, the mentioned content regarding the preprocessor excludes other effects apart from the `-traditional' option.
In C++, identifiers are allowed to contain the `$` character.
You can specify the `"-Eno-dollars-in-identifiers"` option to explicitly forbid the use of `$` symbol.
(GNU C++ permits the `$' symbol by default on some target systems, but not on all.)
Allow implicit conversion from ant type to enumeration type (enumeration) in MEF C++.
In normal situations, converting from an enum to int is allowed in GNU C++, but the reverse is not.

In C++, declaring templates results in smaller code by generating a copy only at the place where each template function is defined. (template declaration generates smaller code by generating a copy only at the definition place for each template function in C++)
To successfully use this option, you must mark `#pragma implementation` (definition) or `#Pragma interface` (declaration) in all files using the template.
The compiler requires all template instantiations to be external types during compilation. You must make the required instances appear in the implementation files.
You can achieve this by using typedef, which references each instance required.
If the default options `-fno-external-templates` are used during compilation, all template instances are explicitly set as built-in.
All member functions (except for constructors and mnew or delete member operators) are considered virtual functions of the containing class.
This does not mean that every call to a member function is made through an internal vtable.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a certain virtual function can be directly called; in such cases, it is directly called.
The second and third types of a conditional expression's parameters can be mismatched.
This expression evaluates to Void. The variable fthis-is-variable in C++ allows assignment to the this pointer.
Merging user-defined free storage management mechanisms into C++ makes the assignable 'this' inappropriate.
By default, assigning a value to "this" inside a class member function is an invalid operation.
To ensure compatibility with the past, you can make this operation effective by using the `-fthis-is-variable` option.
-unsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, similar to unsigned char.
All machines have their own default char type. It could be unsigned char or signed char.
In an ideal situation, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char when relying on the symbolic meaning of data.
However, many programs have already been written using only simple char, and these are either signed or unsigned numbers, depending on the target machine of the programmer.
This option and its counterpart make a program function with their corresponding default values.
The type of a char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it behaves identically to one of them.
If not explicitly specified as `signed' or "unsigned", these options define signed or unsigned bitfields.
By default, bitfields are signed, as they inherit the basic integer type, such as int, which is a signed number. However, if the `-traditional' option is specified, bitfields are always unsigned.
Store string constants in the writable data segment without any special treatment.
This is a terrible idea for compatibility with some old programs, as they consider string constants to be changed by the `-traditional` option as well.
Executive summary.
The impact of COVID-19 on the drug market.
Its influence may be similar to the 2008 economic crisis.
The global COVID-19 epidemic has plunged the whole world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, this disease has left medical service institutions financially strained and on the brink of collapse, and the measures implemented by various governments have caused serious disruptions in the global economy.
For the drug market, the influence of this epidemic is still unclear, and it is difficult to predict, but the possible impact could be significant.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to manufacture illicit substances, as restrictions on mobility also limit the acquisition of precursors and basic chemical reagents.
The transporters, due to travel restrictions, may have to find new routes and methods.
The patterns of using and providing toxic substances may change, potentially hindering the government's ability to respond.
The changes brought about by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but we can still learn some valuable lessons from past crises.
After the economic crisis in 2008, some addicts began to seek cheaper synthetic drugs and shifted their usage to injectable narcotics.
At the same time, various governments reduced their budgets related to narcotics.

If governments around the world respond in the same way to the current economic downturn, preventive measures such as anti-addiction interventions and addiction treatment services may be heavily impacted.
In addition, the priority of interception actions and international cooperation may be reduced, making drug traffickers easier to operate.
Some countries smuggle large quantities of drugs through commercial flights, with these countries' drug trafficking activities expected to be most directly affected.

A messenger carries drugs such as ajmaline, phencyclidine, etc., in their luggage or hidden in personal belongings, sometimes in large quantities. Due to restrictions on air cargo transportation almost everywhere, such commercial air travel activities for transporting drugs could be completely halted.
Despite disruptions to international postal supply chains, there may be an increase in illicit activities using the dark web and parcel delivery.
From a long-term perspective, economic recession and related containment measures may disrupt the drug market.

Due to continuously rising unemployment and lack of opportunities, poverty-stricken and vulnerable populations are more likely to turn to harmful substance abuse, develop substance addiction, and engage in illegal activities related to drugs, be it production or transportation.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of such situations to provide services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members to strengthen their ranks.
With the government's ability to respond diminishing, these changes may take root quickly and become a new reality for many communities.
Expansion and Complexity.
Market growth.
Population growth explains some reasons for market expansion.
The drug addiction phenomenon continues to increase worldwide, whether in terms of the total number or the proportion of addicts in the world population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were approximately 2.1 billion drug users, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64. By contrast, in 2018, it was estimated that there were approximately 2.69 billion drug users, representing 5.3% of the population in this age group.
In the past twenty years, the rate of increase in drug addiction in developing countries far outpaced that of developed countries.

This reflects to some extent the varying population growth rates during this period: 7% for developed countries and 28% for developing ones, yet it also highlights the faster growth of young populations in developing countries.
The proportion of teenagers and young adults is the largest among drug addicts.
During the period from 2000 to 2018, the population in the developing countries in this age group grew by 16%, while the population in the developed countries in this age group decreased by 10%.
Urbanization is a driving factor in the current and future drug market.
The drug addiction situation in urban areas is greater than in rural areas, regardless of developed or developing countries.

One reason for the increase in drug addiction cases is the large-scale migration of population from rural areas to urban areas. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, while this ratio was only 34% in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, particularly in countries where urbanization trends are more prominent.

Wealth increase is linked with a higher prevalence of addiction, but the burden of carrying diseases is greatest for the poorest people worldwide. The prevalence of addiction is more common in developed countries than in developing ones.
Cocaine and the like are particularly linked to affluent regions of the world.
The rate of substance abuse is high among the affluent classes in various countries.
The rate of becoming addicts is higher among those with lower social and economic status.
Data from a few countries indicates a link between harmful addiction patterns and low income.
These patterns are not common in affluent social circles.
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate risks for vulnerable populations, including drug addicts.

For instance, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have historically been linked to an increase in drug use. However, this pandemic has already caused job losses for millions of people around the world.

The outbreak of COVID-19 may further expand the illicit drug market due to various reasons such as increased farming of illicit crops by farmers, weaker regulatory control, or more people being forced into illegal activities due to economic hardships.

Measures related to the containment of COVID-19 have led to a decrease in air and land transportation, resulting in an increase in maritime cargo transport. Maritime interception risks are low, and the volume of maritime smuggling is greater than that of air or land.
Complexity enhancement.

The situation of unregulated appearance of non-internationally controlled substances is stable, but the emerging new types of synthetic opioids are on the rise, posing potential risks, making the drug market increasingly complex.

Besides marijuana, cocaine, and heroin, among other plant-based substances, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added. Many of these are not regulated internationally. The non-medical use of drugs is rapidly increasing.
The domestic market of member countries has approximately 500 new active substances each year.
Currently, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic THC receptor agonists and a small amount of opioids.
Although the overall quantity of new-type psychotropic substances has stabilized, the proportions have changed.
In the number of new types of psychoactive substances determined in 2014, the proportion of novel designer amphetamines was only 2%, but by 2018, this figure had risen to 9%.

Many substances in the new generation of antipsychotic drugs are similar to phenothiazines, and their efficacy and risks have been proven. In North America, they have caused excessive death cases, and there have also been cases in other regions, but the severity is less.
In North America, fentanyl is used as an adulterant for heroin and other narcotics (including cocaine and methamphetamine). It is also used to manufacture counterfeit pharmaceutical fentanyl.

Some evidence suggests that Europe also has the phenomenon of injecting new types of psychoactive substances: A study of residual waste from six European cities found that many syringes were contaminated with substances capable of producing stimulating effects.
The use of two new psychoactive substances may gradually become entrenched in vulnerable populations.
A new type of psychic substance for a single category scarcely forms a large market.
The evidence from Europe indicates that synthesized THC is a serious problem among homeless people and prison inmates in marginalized social groups.
Twenty-two countries have reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most identifying THC as the main challenge.

The regulation of precursor chemicals used in the synthesis of illicit substances such as phenylpropanolamines, methylamphetamines, and "shake and bake" chemicals, has been placed under international control due to their widespread use in the production of various illicit drugs like buprenorphine, methamphetamines, and "shake and bake" tablets.
Drug dealers and drug synthesizers have long been seeking alternatives, not just to substances with less regulation, but also to specifically designed chemicals, known as "precursor chemicals."
Measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 are likely to put additional pressure on addicts dependent on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico indicates that this has become a reality: according to reports, a shortage of precursors for methamphetamine imported from Asia caused methamphetamine prices in Mexico to rise in March 2020.
The market is ever-changing in an instant.
Synthetic drugs replace opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation.
The opiate market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation underwent changes between 2008 and 2018.
The Russian authorities have seized approximately 80% less ecstasy pills, and the number of people receiving treatment for using ecstasy-like substances has significantly decreased.
The market for stimulants seems to be increasingly vibrant.
There is evidence that Jaguar methylamphetamine and various cathinones, including methylphenidate and a-PVP, are widely available on the Russian drug market.
Russian authorities report a sharp increase in the number of clandestine laboratories producing illicit drugs, with a significant rise over the past two years, reaching 152 such sites in 2018.
The opium and methamphetamine market in Afghanistan and Iraq is growing.
As early as 2012, investigations into hospital, prison, and other institution personnel had already revealed the significance of anabolic steroids in Iraq.
Methamphetamine, a derivative of crystal meth, has become another major worrying drug alongside phencyclidine (PCP) and curare.
The findings of 2015 further proved that marijuana is harder to obtain than "phenylpropanolamine" or amphetamines for addicts.

Recently, Iraqi authorities discovered several methylamphetamine production sites. The Drug Enforcement Administration has expressed concern over large-scale imports of precursors for methylamphetamine production at one such site.
In Afghanistan, the production of ajmalicine began around 2014.
Since then, the capture quantity of alkaloids such as ajmaline, mescaline, and scopolamine has been steadily increasing.
The capture amount was approximately 657 kilograms in the first half of 2019 - a significant increase compared to the previous year.
In other countries, large quantities of methamphetamine suspected to originate from Afghanistan have been seized, indicating that their production is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends.
In areas where the use of cannabis is legal for non-medical purposes, there is a trend of increased usage.
Canada, Uruguay, and the United States allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use in 11 jurisdictions each.

In many legal domains, the use of cannabis has increased significantly since its legalization, although the same trend has been observed in other domains where non-medical use of cannabis remains illegal.

In Colorado and Washington states in the United States, the number of adults using marijuana for non-medical purposes has increased significantly, particularly in the past month and almost every day, surpassing the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that the use of marijuana in Uruguay has been increasing since 2011, with a significant jump in usage last month.
This indicates that the main reason for the increase is frequent and constant use of marijuana.
Canadian data for the short term also shows an increase in usage alongside the expansion of the legal market from 2018 to 2019.
Nevertheless, in 2019, about 40% of cannabis users obtained certain products from illegal sources.
Is the decrease in global marijuana arrests due to marijuana legalization?
In 2018, global marijuana plant seizures reached the lowest levels in the past 20 years, primarily due to a 84% decrease in seizures in North America over the past 10 years.

Compared to other regions in the world during the same period, the seizures have nearly doubled. The seizure patterns indicate that the policy of loosening the marijuana market is having a significant impact.

The regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have some restraining effect on their domestic use, but it is still difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of the regulation on new psychoactive substances within the country.
Some countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances exhibit varying popularity rates for these substances.
In some countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation.

Opioid medications used for pain management and palliative care for vulnerable populations are primarily available in the legal and illegal drug markets in high-income countries, with uneven distribution across regions.
In 2018, over 90% of all opioid drugs available for medical consumption were in high-income countries.
Approximately 50% are in North America, 40% are in Europe, and there are 2% in the Atlantic region.
These countries' populations account for approximately 12% of the global population.
According to estimates, 88% of the world population comes from low-income and middle-income countries, but they account for less than 10% of global consumption of pharmaceutical opioids.
The obstacles to obtaining prescription opioids involve various factors, such as legislation, culture, healthcare systems, and prescribing practices.
The risk of addiction to drugs is greater for economically disadvantaged people. In 2018, approximately 3.56 million people were diagnosed with addiction to drugs.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization can increase the risk of substance abuse, and exacerbate its consequences. Research in high-income countries has shown this to be true. In these studies, an individual's unfavorable social-economic trajectory is not only related to their substance abuse risk at a particular point in time.

Drug addiction worsens social and economic disadvantages, further increasing the risks of unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, thereby perpetuating the vicious cycle of disadvantage. These outcomes may also be related to disrespectful attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, ethnic minorities, LGBTQ+ communities, and people displaced due to armed conflicts or disasters, as well as those in rural areas, may be disproportionately affected by opioid addiction or face challenges in accessing treatment services.

According to the Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALY) indicator based on the estimated years of healthy life lost due to disability and premature death, the harmful effects of smoking have had a broader impact on society over the past 10 years.
Between 2007 and 2018, the number of life years lost globally due to drug addiction increased by 17%.

The life expectancy increase rate of disability adjustments for hepatocellular carcinoma (liver cancer) in injection drug users with untreated type B hepatitis is particularly high, reaching up to 40%.
The relationship between drugs and violence is intricately complex, making it difficult to determine the causal relationship between the use of psychoactive substances and violence.
Global data suggests that intoxication is a significant factor in homicides.
In violent events, the effect of alcohol seems to be greater than that of drugs.

Although drug addiction may lead to criminal behavior, in certain circumstances, this relationship can be partially attributed to various intervening factors such as social-economic disadvantage and other types of adversity caused by personal risk, family environment, and peer influence.
The connections between drug trafficking and violence are manifold.
If there is an established criminal structure, including large-scale organized criminal activities such as international drug trafficking, they may be able to carry out their operations peacefully.

In the short term, the existence and degree of violence are not determined by the scale of drug trafficking, but rather by certain changes in the power balance among organized crime groups, such as shifts in the size of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of notorious criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group relative to another.
Latest Trends
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, with the greatest harm similar to that of opioids.
An estimated 1.92 billion people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used illicit drug in the world.
Compared to it, there were 58 million people who used opioids in 2018.
The risks associated with butalbital-containing drugs are often overlooked due to their limited user base.

In 2017, an estimated 167,000 deaths were related to substance abuse. Sixty-six percent of these deaths were caused by these substances. In the 2,100 million life years lost due to disability or premature death attributed to substance abuse, half were caused by these substances.
The use of synthetic opioids for non-medical purposes aggravates public health risks.

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the curveball for the opioid crisis is curvama in the former, and fentanyl in the latter. Despite having almost no commonalities in economic, demographic, or general drug use patterns, both regions are fiercely battling the opioid crisis fueled by easily obtainable and low-cost materials.
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioid analogs has led to a significant increase in opioid-related overdose deaths over the past 20 years.
In the excess deaths registered in the United States in 2018, about two-thirds involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
One reason for the excessive deaths caused by Fentanyl is the unpredictable effectiveness of the drug on the black market for Fentanyl.
In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the market for horses not used for medical purposes has experienced significant growth.
In this region, the number of patients receiving treatment among those afflicted with the hiccups is increasing.
In 2017, the quantity of seized caviar significantly increased, reaching a peak of over 125 tons.
In 2018, the global seizure quantity dropped to 32 tons after India passed a law tightening regulation on cattle trade.

The catalyst for this crisis in these two places is the production of simple and low-cost goods, in addition, there is a lack of international regulation for many Curma and Finnish-like products or their precursors.

The worsening of crises in these two places is due to the fact that these substances have a supply in both the pharmaceutical market and the black market, making it more difficult to detect and prevent their abuse.
The use of stimulants is on the rise.
The market for stimulants is dominated by cocaine and amphetamines, and the usage quantities of both substances are on the rise in their primary markets.
Approximately 1.9 million people used Ketamine in 2018, as it is popular in North America and Western Europe.
Approximately 2.7 million people use thiophenbutylamine in the same year, among whom alkylthiophenbutylamine is the most widely used thiophenbutylamine derivative in Southeast Asia and North America.
Based on the data we have, the use of alpha-methyl-phenethylamine in these two regions has been increasing over the past 20 years.

In some markets, Cocaine and Amphetamines can coexist, sometimes substituting for each other. The use of one drug may increase as the use of the other decreases, or both may increase or decrease simultaneously to meet the demand of the same market.
New coronavirus pneumonia increases the risk for injecting drug users.
An estimated 1.13 million people injected drugs in 2018, and approximately 10% of global HIV infections are caused by injecting drug use.
Over 100,000 injecting drug users are infected with HIV, and there are 550,000 hepatitis B carriers.

In 2017, approximately 58.5 million people died from drug overdoses. About half of these deaths were caused by hepatitis B-related liver diseases, and most cases of hepatitis B in injecting drug users remain untreated.
The shortage of cough suppressants caused by COVID-19 restrictions may lead users to substitute them with alcohol or bromide-type drugs, or mix them with synthetic drugs instead.
With some users switching to injections or increasing their frequency of injections, there may be an emergence of more harmful usage patterns.

The European Union summit is grappling with refugee policy issues, with EU officials: the refugee reception process is becoming increasingly bottlenecked - Chinanews.com.
The European Union summit is in turmoil over refugee policies, European Union officials: Each step in the reception process is facing bottlenecks.

EU Commission Chairman Ursula von der Leyen announced at the latest EU summit on February 10, as reported by Reuters, that EU leaders agree to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration to facilitate the expulsion of illegal immigrants more easily.

According to reports, the European Union's move is a response to the growing issue of illegal immigration in Europe. The core issue for the European Union now is that the number of illegal immigrants who can be deported is very small.
According to the summit document, EU leaders urged the commission to "immediately mobilize large amounts of EU funds" to strengthen external borders through infrastructure and monitoring means.
However, the European Union and its member countries continue to argue over issues such as fence payment costs.
Fen Deleiian repeatedly stated that EU funds will not cover related expenses.

Some diplomats from certain member countries have stated that if the European Union assumes the cost of installing cameras, watchtowers, and other infrastructure along their external borders, it will free up national budgets for these countries and accelerate the construction process.

European Euractiv website reports that EU officials acknowledge that every step in the refugee reception process is facing bottlenecks due to limited reception capacity and overwhelmed immigration authorities in member states, resulting in an almost "permanent crisis" situation for the EU refugee reception system.
According to the European Union Commission, the EU received over 92,000 asylum applications from its member states last year, a nearly 50% increase from the previous year.
At the same time, the European Union recorded over 33,000 cases of illegal border crossings last year.
In this context, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle," namely, that European Union countries can return illegal immigrants to another member country based on its court judgments.
In addition, reports indicate that EU leaders have agreed to "expand the use of the concept of secure countries," paving the way for the EU to establish a common list.
(Source: Global Times, Author: Ni Ruifei)
The United States upgrades "chip war," dealing a heavy blow to the global semiconductor industry - Chinanews.com.

Recently, the US-China "chip war" is showing signs of significant escalation — first, the Netherlands and Japan, under US pressure, agreed to initiate export control of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China; then, media reported that the US government is considering cutting off all connections between US suppliers and Huawei, prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden administration is also preparing to issue an administrative order restricting US investment in sensitive Chinese tech industries... By the beginning of the year 2023, the US has been persistently taking countermeasures against the development of China's semiconductor-related industries.

In recent years, the United States has not ceased its actions to suppress China's semiconductor development. On one hand, it has precisely targeted the Chinese semiconductor supply chain, and on the other hand, it has built a "de-globalization" alliance for the semiconductor industry, aiming to completely "cut off" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Regardless of establishing a "technology alliance" with South Korea, or forming a semiconductor "four-party alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and the Taiwan region, or using the US-Japan-Australia "Quad mechanism" or "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework" to build a semiconductor industry "closed-loop value chain," the United States aims to introduce political, factional, and weaponized means into the semiconductor industry through these methods, in an attempt to construct a US-dominated closed production and supply chain, and thereby compensate for its deficiencies in semiconductor manufacturing, and maintain its advantageous position in the global semiconductor industry.
However, the U.S.'s hardline approach towards China also inflicts self-harm to some extent.

Recently, GlobalWafers, a well-known chip manufacturing equipment supplier in the United States, announced that they will lay off 1,300 permanent employees and plan to terminate the employment of 1,400 temporary workers in the next two quarters due to the influence of the latest round of export restrictions on chip manufacturing equipment to China.

ASML, the Dutch global leader in lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, has recently issued a warning against exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China, which may lead to an increase in semiconductor prices.

Analysis by American media reveals that many American companies have been severely impacted by the harsh measures implemented by the US government against China's chip and semiconductor industries. This includes electronic design automation tool developers, chip designers, wafer fabrication equipment manufacturers, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry by the United States is pulling down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive sector, with a tightly knit global semiconductor industry chain already in place.

According to professional estimates, with specialized division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products requires crossing national borders over 70 times, taking a total of over 100 days.

Despite the strong foundation of the US semiconductor industry, it is relatively weak in manufacturing capabilities, particularly in advanced process technologies, and heavily relies on the Asia Pacific region.

Despite the United States' efforts to lead the advanced chip supply chain towards a "closed circle" region under its control, the global semiconductor industry's regional distribution and interdependence situation is difficult to change.
The powerful "reshaping" and "de-Sinicization" of the semiconductor industry chain in the United States significantly disrupts the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of global future industries, the development of the chip industry cannot do without the common participation of countries around the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively introducing the "America COMPETES Act" of 2022, the "Chips and Sciences Act," using tech dominance to consolidate its technological superiority; towards allies, it applies pressure and induces Intel, TSMC, Samsung, and other chip manufacturing companies to set up factories in the U.S., exerting great efforts to secure America's global leadership in the chip industry.
In the short term, the US has caused trouble for China's semiconductor industry and related industries, but gained real benefits.

In the long run, the suppression and pressure on China's semiconductor industry by the United States will force it to continuously break through, resulting in the loss of a huge Chinese market for American tech companies. This will ultimately greatly weaken the innovation willingness and ability of US tech enterprises, and harm the development of the global semiconductor industry.

The first batch of individual pension savings financial products are on sale with a minimum holding period of 360 days - Chinanews.com.
The first batch of individual pension savings financial products are on sale.
A family institution offers seven products to choose from, with a minimum holding period of 360 days.
Individual retirement savings financial product has been launched.

February 10, China Finance Online released the first batch of personal pension fund products, with seven personal pension fund products from Guangfa Fund Management, Agricultural Bank of China Fund Management, and China Postal Savings Bank officially going on sale.

To date, the "shelves" of my personal pension account have finally gathered my personal pension savings, personal pension investment, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund products.

According to the introduction, all the first-batch individual pension fund financial products are of the publicly offered net asset value open-ended type, with 5 new issues and 2 continuing products. Except for one product which is a hybrid type, the other 6 products are all fixed income type.

Beijing Youth Daily reporter observed that out of the five newly launched products, four were from Guotai Finance, all of which were fixed income products with holding periods of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and their corresponding yields were approximately 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% - 4.60%, 4.40% - 4.90%, and 5.25% - 5.75% respectively.

One remaining new product is "Mailian Caifu Tianyi Hongjin with a Maturity of 1095 Days, No. 1", which is a fixed income product. It started collecting funds on February 10, 2023, and ended on February 19, 2023. The risk level is rated as level 2.

Two of the surviving products are the "Agricultural Bank of China's Agricultural Bank of China "Nongming Tongxin Lingdong" 360-day Sci-Tech Renminbi Savings Product" and the "Agricultural Bank of China's Agricultural Bank of China 360-day Sci-Tech Renminbi Savings Product" (the former is referred to as Product A and the latter as Product B). Product A is a hybrid investment product with a risk level of three.

Another surviving product is "Postal Savings Wealth Management Product - Hongjin with a Minimum Holding Period of 365 Days No. 1" which is of a fixed income type. It started collecting funds on December 30, last year, and officially began operation on January 4, this year. The accumulated net value as of February 8 is 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the State Council General Office on Promoting the Development of Personal Pension Funds," eligible investments for personal pension fund accounts include bank savings, bank wealth management products, commercial annuities, and public funds (mutual funds).

The first batch of individual pension fund financial products have gone on sale, marking the official availability for individual pension fund investors to purchase financial products using their individual pension fund accounts.

The China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the "Temporary Measures for the Administration of Personal Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Finance Companies" in November last year.

According to the regulations of "Methods," participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension investment products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension fund products through their individual pension insurance accounts for their personal pension plans.

Afterwards, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation issued notices, specifying that the personal pension system would be implemented in Beijing, Tianjin, and 34 other cities and regions including Shijiazhuang in Hebei, Xiong'an New Area, and Jinchang City in Shanxi, as pilot areas.

As of the end of 2022, there were 1954 thousand people participating in the personal pension scheme, and 613 thousand people were making contributions, with a total contribution amount of 142 billion yuan.
Previously, banks participating in the pilot only offered individual retirement savings accounts, individual retirement insurance products, and individual retirement mutual funds.
With the convergence of individual pension funds for retirement savings, investors are left to ponder which products to choose.

The expert from Joint Bank's Financial Product Development Department stated that the retirement financial products in the trial stage and personal retirement financial products share three common features.

One is stability, with more complete risk management mechanisms, investment strategies and ideas becoming more stable, and implementation of third-party independent custody outside of the mother bank.

The second type is long-term, with retirement financial products having terms of 5 years or more during the trial phase. The next personal retirement savings financial products to be issued have a minimum holding period of one year, with encouragement to hold for 3 years or more.

Three is inclusive, the purchase threshold of the products is low, with an average starting price of 1 yuan, some as low as 0.01 yuan. The product management fees, handling fees, and other rates are more favorable.
Professional experts suggest that investors should choose based on the product characteristics and their own risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have the characteristics of long maturities, high interest rates, and high safety, making them suitable for populations with weak risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products prioritize protection and are more suitable for those who cannot bear investment risk and can accept stable returns; however, personal pension investment products and mutual fund products in pension savings do not guarantee principal or returns and carry certain investment risks, but offer potential for higher expected returns, making them more suitable for individuals with sufficient financial knowledge and higher risk tolerance.
Reporter Cheng Yaxian, Pool Haibo (Pool is a surname in this context)
The fitness industry should discard the trust crisis - Chinanews.com
Another large-scale fitness club went bankrupt?
Recently, the membership rights of fitness club members at a well-known fitness institution have drawn social attention.

After the Chinese New Year, several members found that their branch was not operating normally. Rumors of the institution's bankruptcy and disappearance alarmed members, leading to intervention by public security and labor departments.
Lastly, the relevant personnel from the institution came forward to respond, promising to make efforts to ensure the legal rights of employees and members, calming the storm.

Some fitness institutions' branches have encountered operational issues and temporarily closed. Consumers could calmly wait for the resolution of the problem. Why then are some members' first reactions "something's not right"?
The members' rights disputes at a fitness club are rooted in deeper trust issues within the industry.
Domestic traditional fitness centers generally operate on a prepaid model, with "earning money from users who don't come" being the underlying logic of their development.

Obtaining cash flow through presale membership cards, opening new stores continuously seems to form a circulating pattern, but in fact, it's a case of "one eats another's rice," unable to establish a stable profit model.
Negative information about fitness clubs and related industries is frequently disseminated, causing significant impact on consumer confidence.
From the market outlook, a fitness club is certainly a profitable business.
Fitness competitions may fluctuate but always attract capital attention.
Multiple data show that the popularity in areas such as cultural and sports consumption is on the rise, and the market continues to warm up.

In the fitness market specifically, with the steady improvement of residents' living standards, the concept of healthy living is deeply rooted in people's minds, providing great opportunities for the development of the fitness industry.
The situation is becoming more favorable, the industry pays greater attention to the development of quality.

Some institutions are overly optimistic about the fitness market's recovery after consumption, having just emerged from a crisis, and are sounding the alarm for expansion, pouring financing into new store construction all at once.

It cannot be denied, due to the influence of the epidemic in the past few years, many institutions have withdrawn, and the industry is undergoing restructuring. However, powerful enterprises are selectively increasing their acquisition capabilities and repositioning themselves, which may also bring new opportunities.
However, for the fitness market to develop sustainably and climb the long-term growth path, the industry must change its traditional modes and operating strategies.
Only by being reliable and trustworthy can we rebuild consumer trust and confidence, and only then can we truly win the market and the future.
Instead of competing with each other to capture the market in the fitness industry, what is needed now is to focus on improving services and developing with high quality to retain users.
First, retain users through service.

A fitness center belongs to the service industry, with its essence being to firmly focus on "user-centeredness," closely surrounding user requirements, and placing the operational focus on service quality improvement.
Next, we need to enhance user experience through digital transformation.
For instance, the popular internet fitness club model operates with a pay-per-use system and allows users to choose their own venues.
Simultaneously, body data and motion data are effectively utilized, and social needs are satisfied, achieving a complete service loop from online to offline.
Without private tutoring sales and large annual contracts, users' concerns about leaving fitness institutions have decreased, and trust has been elevated.
Additionally, we should actively explore diverse business models.

Today, sports consumption has evolved from single service to scene consumption. Fitness clubs have the potential to become new consumer entry points, with sports supplements and fitness equipment, among other related products, becoming new sources of revenue, providing consumers with more diverse choices.
Note: Jiang Tianyun is a Chinese name, where "姜" (Jiang) is the family name and "天骄" (Tianyun) is the given name.
Buy back at a discounted price!
Nanjing real estate market sees "price difference compensation" - Chinanews.com

Yangzhou Evening News reporter Ma Xubo discovered in an interview on the 10th that the "price guarantee agreement," which had not been seen for over a decade, had re-emerged in the Nanjing real estate market. A real estate project in the Jiangbei New District of Nanjing claims to offer "price difference compensation." Before moving in, other housing sources offer greater discounts than previous discounts, and the developer is willing to exchange houses and refund the price difference to buyers.
The conditions for a guarantee agreement are not few.
Mr. Sun, a potential buyer, discovered a "declaration" at the Saville Garden Cloud Terrace, a building located in the Jiangbei New District, during his weekend visit to the property last week.

The developer, as shown in the image given to the media, promises that for any property purchased between February 1st and February 28th, from the date of signing the sales contract to the delivery of the corresponding property, if there are other unsold properties of the same product type, same building, same unit, and same property type with greater discounts, the developer will offer a replacement and refund the difference.

Mr. Sun stated that the real estate consultant indicated this was a "guaranteed pricing agreement." The purpose is to give the buyer peace of mind, without worrying about the developer lowering prices for promotions. "I'm afraid to buy it now and then it drops in price. I'd rather not buy it and regret it, but if I don't buy it, I'll truly miss out."
Many home buyers still believe that "appraisal agreements," although they provide reassurance, come with stringent conditions.

A Zhen woman intends to buy a new house in Jiangbei and says that the priced properties must have the same floor plan, be in the same building, and even in the same unit. Consequently, the "threshold" for such properties is quite high, as the number of comparable properties is limited.
Some home buyers believe that, due to information asymmetry, sellers may not exclude providing extra concessions during sales, making it no easy task for buyers to enforce their rights.
Whether the buyer will stay or not is worth observing.

Journalists found out from the real estate section of a website in Nanjing that this project sold a total of 252 units of housing last November, with sizes ranging from 105 square meters to 114 square meters and 129 square meters, and the fully furnished sale prices were approximately 39,843 yuan per square meter.

After two and a half months, the number of unsold units in the real estate project online is 157, accounting for 62.3% of the total. In building 8, there are a total of 128 units, with 113 unsold units. In building 7, there are 124 units, of which 44 are unsold. The total number of units sold in the project is only 33, accounting for 13%.
Market insiders introduced that a "Put Option Agreement" had appeared in Nanjing as early as 2008.

In August of that year, Xi's Courtyard in Hexi Yellow Mountain Road offered a "Price Guarantee Plan" to attract home buyers. The details were: "The company solemnly promises that if the project's discount amount increases within one year, the difference will be refunded to the original homeowners by the company."
After April 2011, nine real estate projects in Nanjing also offered discount compensation for some of their properties.
The housing market is warming up, and now more than ever, it needs a "shot in the arm."
A seasoned dealer in the Nanjing real estate industry, Mr. Chen, stated that "insurance agreements" are also one of the marketing methods for property developers.
He believes that developing enterprises require more confidence than buying houses now, and the "guarantee agreement" is actually meant to boost their morale.
As for whether we can retain home buyers, he said it depends on the influence of various factors such as housing policy and loan thresholds, and it remains to be seen for now.
Multiple data indicators show a decline in Taiwan's economic performance at the beginning of the year - China News Service.

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11th (Reporters Zhao Bo, Huang Yang) - Export trade volumes "in the red five times," manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) contracted for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) showed "three consecutive increases"...... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have been releasing economic data for January 2023 in succession.
Expert analysis shows that the Taiwan economy has a lackluster start to the year, with pressure to grow not insignificant.

According to the financial authority of the Taiwan region's administrative body, the exports from Taiwan amounted to $315.1 billion in January this year, a decrease of 21.2% compared to the same period last year, marking the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The exports of the eleven major categories of goods have all decreased compared to the same period last year.
The decline in rubber products and optical devices is the most significant, with annual decreases of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
The export of electronic components decreased by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decrease in the past 11 years.
Among them, integrated circuits decreased by 18.3% year-on-year, the largest drop in the past 14 years.

The director of the statistics department, Cai Meina, stated that this indicates the weakening effect of the demand saturation in the consumer electronics industry is spreading, signaling the industry's entry into a correction period.
According to statistics, Taiwan's imports and exports both decreased in January, with exports falling short at only $23.4 billion, reaching the lowest level in nearly 3 years.

The Taiwan authorities in charge of financial affairs believe that global demand for terminals is decreasing, industry adjustments are restraining manufacturers' purchasing intentions, and export slump is unlikely to improve in the short term, making Taiwan's export decline in the first quarter of this year a possibility that exceeds expectations.

According to the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the seasonally adjusted manufacturing PMI for Taiwan in January 2023 was 40.4%, a decrease of 3.3 percentage points from the previous month, and the seventh consecutive month of contraction.
In the economic monitoring index system, the PMI is the demarcation line at 50%, with an index above 50% representing an expansion, and below 50% a contraction.
In January, the five sub-indexes of Taiwan's PMI showed a contraction in new orders, production, and employment, along with a shortening of supplier delivery times and inventory levels.

The six major industries all showed contraction in their PMI readings, ranked in order of contraction speed as follows: power generation and machinery industry (35.1%), electronics and optical equipment industry (35.2%), chemical and pharmaceutical industries (39.2%), basic raw materials industry (42.4%), transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and food and textile industries (45.7%).

The "Budget, Accounting and Statistics Department" under the Taiwan authorities announced that the CPI year-on-year increase rate in Taiwan for January 2023 was 3.04%, surpassing 3% again since July last year.
Among them, vegetable prices surged 28.25%, reaching a new high in the past 17 months.

The "Taiwan Central Economic Council" spokesperson Cao Zhihong admitted frankly that the vegetable price increase exceeded expectations. Excluding the Spring Festival factor, the average CPI for January and February this year is expected to be around 2.71% of last December's figure. Inflationary pressure still exists and remains at a high level.
According to reports in the United Daily News and "Yahoo Finance" among other Taiwanese media, experts are pessimistic about the Taiwanese economy this year.

Professor Wu Daren of the Economics Department at Tsinghua University analyzes that the export downturn may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturing companies, increasing the risk of debt default.
At the same time, a decrease in orders leads to manufacturers reducing labor costs, affecting the labor market and family economics, and in turn, impacting consumer ability.

Qu Daogen, a researcher at the Taiwan Economic Research Institute, believes that the inflation situation in Europe and America has not been resolved, and the demand continues to shrink, estimating that the Taiwanese export recession will persist into the first half of the year.
Due to Taiwan's economy being export-driven, its annual economic growth will be less than last year, given the impact of export downturn.

Report: The number of returning students seeking employment in China after studying abroad in 2022 reached a new record high - Chinanews.com
Top 10 destinations for returning students seeking employment in 2022. Source: "2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report"

China Central News Net, Beijing, February 11, 2022 (Meng Rui) recently released the "2022 China Returned Overseas Talent Employment Survey Report" (hereafter referred to as "the report"). The report shows that the number of graduating overseas students in 2022 increased by 8.6% compared to the previous year. The number of returning overseas students seeking employment also reached a new record high. The demand for overseas talent from Chinese enterprises is also on the rise.

The report shows that the number of returning overseas graduates seeking jobs in China has significantly increased since 2020, and the number of graduating students returning to seek employment has also risen.
Compared to 2021, the number of graduating international students in 2022 increased by 8.6% and the number of returning graduates seeking employment set a new record.

According to the distribution of returning job-seeking students' study abroad countries, the UK has the highest proportion, which is 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%). The ranking is consistent with 2021.
The number of new graduates from Malaysia, Japan, and Singapore studying abroad has increased significantly compared to the previous year. The growth rates are 66.1%, 50.9%, and 37.7% respectively.
The number of incoming students from Canada, Germany, the United States, and Australia has decreased compared to last year.
Trend of returning college graduates' job supply in the first week after Chinese New Year 2023. Source: "2022 China Graduate Employment Survey Report."

According to the survey, among the returning students, 58% believe that "living in the country is more convenient," 40% decide to return due to "greater affinity for the domestic cultural environment," 32% believe that "there are more job opportunities in the country," and 22% believe that "economic activities in the country will recover faster, providing more job opportunities."
The data shows that the demand for overseas talent by domestic enterprises is rapidly increasing, and the demand for returning overseas talents is on an upward trend.

In the first week after the Chinese New Year in 2023, the number of job openings prioritizing returning graduates and the number of returning graduates seeking employment both showed an uptrend. The number of returning graduate job openings on February 3 was 11% higher than on January 28, and the number of returning graduates seeking employment increased by 27%.

In the industry, the proportion of jobs in the returning program in 2022 from the education/training sector is 27.8%, ranking first. The professional services/consulting industry and the internet/e-commerce industry rank second and third with 14.3% and 11.1% respectively.
The number of returning overseas Chinese seeking jobs domestically has changed in recent years. Source: "2022 China Returned Overseas Chinese Employment Survey Report."

According to salaries, the average recruitment salary for returning overseas talents has continued to rise for three consecutive years, reaching 14,680 RMB/month in 2022, an increase of 961 RMB/month from 2021, a growth of 7%.

By region, in 2022, the proportion of returning graduates going to first-tier, second-tier, and third-tier cities and below for development showed an increase, with delivery ratios of 31%, 15.7%, and 14.3% respectively, all higher than the delivery ratios in 2021.
Fifty-two point seven percent of returning students expressed that their study abroad experience met their expectations, an increase of 2.8 percentage points compared to the previous year (49.9%).
Twenty-eight point two percent of returning overseas students exceed or significantly exceed expectations, a ratio higher than the 25.4% in 2021.

Can we save half the cost or even more?
Henan Provincial Standardized Integration of Dental Implant Medical Services Pricing - Chinanews.com
CCTV News: Planting teeth is an ideal choice for many toothless patients, but the price of tens of thousands of yuan per tooth has long been a barrier for many of them.
This year, with the accelerated rollout of tooth implant planting and harvesting, prices for tooth implants have been lowered in various places.

From February 10, the price control target for the entire process of regular tooth implant services in Henan Province is 4,300 yuan. The fee for a single regular tooth implant process should not exceed 97% of the target price.
Implant-supported dental restorations refer to a type of tooth replacement method that utilizes a bottom structural foundation within the bone to support and firmly anchor upper denture prosthetics.

A journalist learned from the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University that the price for a single regular transplant, from cultivation to final repair, is approximately 16,700 to 17,000 yuan.
The patient He Xian: After the new policy, the doctors told me that for cases like mine, it would save around 8,000 to 10,000 yuan, roughly half.

Based on existing projects, Henan Province has integrated and determined the prices for 15 dental implant service items, including "per-tooth implant planting fee," and uniformly set the prices and medical insurance payment categories for provincial public medical institutions. Twenty medical service price items related to dental implant surgery have been canceled or adjusted.

Zhengzhou City Medical Insurance Bureau Pharmacy Price and Bidding Purchase Department Director Li Yunjie: The main beneficiaries are four parties. One is the medical insurance, as its expenditure decreases; the hospitals have less pressure, and patients will increase moderately; for suppliers, it provides a market; for us patients, it is the greatest beneficiary, and the cost of getting a tooth filled may be reduced by half or even more.
Shenzhen: Building China's First, World-Leading High-Speed Frontier City - China New Network

Propose the construction of a high-speed, large-capacity, low-latency super broadband network by the end of 2023, achieving the "double hundred Mbps, all-optical network, 1ms, IoT" network construction goal, and building the first and world-leading ultra-fast pioneer city in China.
The plan proposes to accelerate the upgrade of Gigabit Ethernet networks.
By the end of 2023, the market share of 10G PON ports reaches 100%, with over 100 high-tech industrial parks (industrial zones) in the area.
The plan requires a comprehensive improvement in 5G network efficiency.

Building a city-level high-quality wireless local area network.
Establishing WLAN service standards for public spaces, promoting the upgrading of WLAN in densely populated and high-consumption areas of the city to provide Gigabit access capabilities.

Leveraging the "Deepi Network" to build a unified authentication management platform for the entire city's public wireless LAN, achieving "one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching," and supporting the inclusion of social self-built APs (wireless access points) with public service capabilities in the authentication management platform for operating entities.
